f6_assessments.q0: This project does meet the intentions of challenge to raise awareness of bad players in the ecosystem although the implementation and how that could be scalable are little light in details
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer seems to have the required skills to develop the project, but again details surrounding how the project would be executed to do some of things that this project would do are not clearly stated.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has some high level deliverables about the solution will be implemented but lacks within the timeline or roadmap how those items would be measured up to as a success.  Size and interactions of a community are things that could be highlighted

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal exhibits a very good idea that could successfully address the problems of the campaign. A website containing the identified scams, frauds, FUDs, cyber-attacks etc would be extremely useful to help anyone assess if that content they have come across is true or not. Besides that, the idea of having a single page that categorize the types of scams is really helpful for newcomers. Also, the goals of the proposal are strongly aligned with the outlined challenge settings. The proposer clearly articulates that the solution will build a repository of scam attempts, it will make easier for truth about Cardano to be established because the cyber-attacks will be debunked, and transparency will be enhanced because individuals will be able to find the necessary references in the platform. However, it is not clear from the proposal how they intend to scale the solution in the future once it grows beyond what is manageable for the initial team.
f6_assessments.q1: No evidence was provided to support the claim of the author of having 7 years of experience as a full-stack web developer. Also, no arguments regarding the type and number of team members that will be needed were shared. The budget is broken down into the most relevant items and the amount requested is reasonable. However, there is no plan in case additional funding is required. Also, the timetable is realistic but could have been divided into more milestones. Some of the stages of the project could have been better explained in terms of how things will happen. For instance, how communities will form around identifying scams and how they intend to expand their userbase were not much explored. Finally, the proposer does not consider the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation and there are many. For example, scalability might be a big issue, maybe they will face technical problems during the development of the platform or even have difficulty in attracting people to adopt the new tool.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided has too few milestones, it could have been further explored. On the other hand, the time horizon of the proposal and the deadlines of the milestones are reasonable. One idea to enhance auditability is a periodic report, at least monthly that could be released to better follow the progress of the project. Regarding the four metrics described (two direct and two indirect) only the first seems aligned with the proposal. It is not clear from the solution how it is supposed to impact the other three metrics. Instead, some metrics that could have been defined were number of end-users of the platform, number of scam attempts exhibited on the website and a measure of trust in the Cardano environment to assess if it was eroded by any cyber-attack (maybe even compare a decline of trust from an attack before the platform was active and after it was published). All in all, there is an understandable description of the targeted problem, but I believe the solution lacks a better preparation and more thoughts on how it will be implemented and audited.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is within the challenge goal of this campaign, having a scam database will help the ecosystem. The Impact of this project is seen if implemented well , I would suggest the proposer collaborate with other teams working with similar solutions to avoid work duplication.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is about gathering all the information about scams/fud/misinformation and placing them all in a user-friendly platform for the community. This is a great idea to gather all the disinformation in one place and certainly fits within the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the proposer, he states that he has 7years of experience in web development and gives us a CV to support this. I have some concerns in regards to the further development of the proposal. The proposer gives us no insight on how he plans on gathering the sighting of scams, frauds, fake news, ... Is the proposer planning on doing this himself or does he plan on building an algorithm that can detect these by itself? We the website be community-driven, if so how does the proposer plan on implementing the disinformation? Will it be verified by users or by other means? The proposal leaves in this regard to much gaps on how we know for sure that the information given on the website is truly facts and not disinformation itself.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding auditability, we have the information needed. The roadmap delivers us with clean deadlines on what the proposer wants the have in a 3,6,12 months timeframe. What we are missing tho is how does the proposer plan on communicating this. Will he do it through social media, will it be visible on GitHub?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal well identifies a problem within the challenge. Informing the community is a simple language and in a central trusted database could be very helpful and especially to known technical members. The problem and solution are well explained although in a short and clear way. 
The key goals of the proposal align with the outlined challenge settings as it provides a repository of old/new scams, scam attempts, fake debunked theories, and falsehoods that can be easily checked and accessed
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has good experience in full-stack web development and shared also his CV as an attachment. However, it would have been helpful to have more information about a relevant experience related to the solution. For example, a similar web developed by the proposer or example related work. The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and the number of hours and rate seems to be reasonable.  It is not clear, however, what will happen after the development of the website. How it will be maintained over time and especially as content will be added. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the first phase of the work.
Missing some more details about the solution for example who will upload the data over time or how can we trust the data uploaded. What does it mean community-managed website? who from the community will manage it and how it will be renumerated? In my view the proposal deal mainly with the technical aspect of building the solution and not the full solution which includes populating, promoting, and managing such a platform. I would have suggested collaborating with other platforms such as AIM or PACE so it could be part of the community tools.  You could also consider adding more team members with complementary experiences to build a full solution.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap with milestones and a time horizon is clear for the development of the database. However as mentioned it is not clear what will happen after the development. There are good Metrics of success and KPIs that are mentioned in the challenge "Key Metrics to measure" section. It would have been good to see more details about those KPIs, for example, what will be estimations for scams that uploaded and monthly users. 

I have worked with many startups and developers throughout my career and while from the technology side, you might have addressed the problem from a full solution perspective I believe there is not enough information to understand how the solution will be implemented and managed over time. Probably more funding will be needed or another model to be able to implement, manage and scale the solution as a solid platform for the community.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge as it creates a repository of different types of scams, frauds, FUDs, fake news, disinformation, cyber attacks, etc. This idea will also help community-managed websites expand to include historical and current content about different types of Cardano scams, bad-faith players, untruths and FUD spreading. With the current smartphone of the world is more than 6 billions (including Cardano users) so people can greatly benefit from the be-aware and alerts system this proposal would create. It would be perfect if the proposer can tell how the information is being collected and by what criteria?
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal informs readers with proposer's experience, the development planning, timeline and budget breakdown. There are three of my concerns about the feasibility:
(1) As the proposer said he has 7 years of professional experience in full-stack web development, I think it would be better if he inform readers some more reference about his skills or a portfolio of websites he created. 
(2) It would be better if the development plan provides more specific steps about how the proposer collects information, categorises them into groups.
(3) Since the proposal wants to be opened for FAQs and criticisms of Cardano as well as answers to criticisms. I suggest that this proposal to add more risks or challenges when facing with criticisms (or even crisis).

Therefore, I give the score of 4 for feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: I agree that this proposal provides me with quite sufficient information to access the progress, roadmap with milestones and timeline. I hope the proposer will add more specific KPIs to the proposal like how many Cardano users will engage on the website or how many new users can reach out to it.  However, I believe this proposal can be implemented and attain its goal successfully.
